intro: Coccocypselum sessile, commonly known as the sessile coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
